intro: Moronobea candida, commonly known as the white moronobea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it may be invasive in some areas.
